is that it is a um static analysis engine um that um is semantic in the
sense that it will actually parse your program build the abstract syntax tree and do a bunch of analysis on top of

essentially the question you want to answer is something like is there a flow
of data in the system where an input parameter which is untrusted enters the system that could be a URL parameter is
then passed through your program using a sense different function calls
assignments all sorts of flow in your program maybe it's called to functions and libraries maybe it becomes sanitized
maybe it doesn't eventually it ends up in a dangerous place and so dangerous place depends on the security threat
we're modeling but that could be call to the database it could be manipulating the Dom in the case of the client side
uh cross side scripting attack so being able to answer a question like is there a flow that goes
from untrusted passes through the program does not go through a sanitizer
and eventually ends up in a dangerous place that's a really difficult question to answer and you need a sophisticated
analysis to do that precisely and that's what it does and so it's uh maybe a little bit
unique in that the the the approach is that it considers code as data and it literally uh runs builds a database of
your code at every commit at every inversion point and then when you want to ask questions does this pattern exist
at this point in the history you run queries on that database and the query language that you use to do that is
called ql and this is this uh slightly weird uh but powerful objected
objectoriented logic programming language that's used as a query language for this database and it's highly
specialized to run these analysis in a in a performant way so it's kind of a nice abstraction
build a database run a bunch of analyses as queries to that database however I do want to say that
you don't need to learn all this stuff to use this technology it comes with what I call batteries included which

year another Point that's uh again more of a philosophy is that we are targeting
a low F false positive rate again the point is we want to create good
experiences for developers and if you create a tool that creates a lot of noise it says there are all sorts of
problems in this code and then when you look at it it's not really real you piss off the developer and they're not happy
uh and they ignore the findings so you don't want to do that so we try really carefully to keep the false positive
rate very low so if the tool says there is a problem it's highly likely that there is actually something there or
maybe there's not but then there's sort of you wouldn't be disappointed at why the Tool uh might thought there there
was a problem and that's a judgment call and it's a data problem it it's not never perfect but that's what we're
